items.title: At least 10 killed in Israeli strikes on Lebanon - state media
items.standfirst: A senior Hezbollah official was among those reported killed in air strikes on the Bekaa Valley and southern Lebanon.
items.content: A senior Hezbollah official was among those reported killed in air strikes on the Bekaa Valley and southern Lebanon.

items.title: At least 10 killed in Israeli strikes in Lebanon’s Bekaa valley, health ministry says
items.standfirst: Hezbollah leader among dead as Israel says it hit militant command centresAt least 10 people have been killed and 24 wounded – including three children – in Israeli strikes in Lebanon’s eastern Bekaa valley, the Lebanese health ministry has said.Israel said it had hit “command centres” of the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah in the Bekaa valley. Two security sources told Reuters that senior Hezbollah leader Hussein Yaghi was killed in the attacks. Continue reading...
items.content: Hezbollah leader among dead as Israel says it hit militant command centresAt least 10 people have been killed and 24 wounded – including three children – in Israeli strikes in Lebanon’s eastern Bekaa valley, the Lebanese health ministry has said.Israel said it had hit “command centres” of the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah in the Bekaa valley. Two security sources told Reuters that senior Hezbollah leader Hussein Yaghi was killed in the attacks. Continue reading...

items.title: At least 12 killed in Israeli strikes on Lebanon - including senior Hezbollah official
items.standfirst: Israeli airstrikes have killed at least 10 people in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley and another two people in a Palestinian refugee camp, the Lebanese Health Ministry has said.
items.content: Israeli airstrikes have killed at least 10 people in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley and another two people in a Palestinian refugee camp, the Lebanese Health Ministry has said.

items.title: Israeli attacks kill at least 12 people, injure dozens across Lebanon
items.standfirst: Lebanese media said Israel targeted Ein el-Hilweh refugee camp in southern Lebanon and a building in the country's east.
items.content: Lebanese media said Israel targeted Ein el-Hilweh refugee camp in southern Lebanon and a building in the country's east.

items.title: Trump considers strike on Iran as Tehran says draft nuclear deal coming soon
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Friday said he was considering a limited strike on Iran as he sent a major naval buildup to the region with the goal of pressurising Tehran to cut a deal that would curb its nuclear programme. Iran's foreign minister said a draft proposal for an agreement with Washington would be ready in a matter of days.

clusters.title: ‘The costs could rise’: Austria manslaughter ruling could alter climbing in Europe
clusters.neutral_headline: Climber Convicted Of Manslaughter After Girlfriend Dies

items.title: ‘The costs could rise’: Austria manslaughter ruling could alter climbing in Europe
items.standfirst: Amateur climber’s conviction over girlfriend’s death could put people off activity, say expertsClimber convicted of manslaughter after leaving girlfriend on Austria’s highest peak to seek helpThe decision of an Austrian court to convict an amateur climber of manslaughter after he had left his girlfriend behind to die on an Alpine peak in winter is certain to be examined closely throughout Europe.In his decision in Innsbruck, the judge, Norbert Hofer – a climber, and an expert in Austrian law relating to the mountains – ruled that the “galaxies-wide” disparity in experience and skills between Thomas P and his late girlfriend Kerstin G meant he had been de facto acting as her mountain guide “as a favour” despite no financial arrangement having been involved. Continue reading...
items.content: Amateur climber’s conviction over girlfriend’s death could put people off activity, say expertsClimber convicted of manslaughter after leaving girlfriend on Austria’s highest peak to seek helpThe decision of an Austrian court to convict an amateur climber of manslaughter after he had left his girlfriend behind to die on an Alpine peak in winter is certain to be examined closely throughout Europe.In his decision in Innsbruck, the judge, Norbert Hofer – a climber, and an expert in Austrian law relating to the mountains – ruled that the “galaxies-wide” disparity in experience and skills between Thomas P and his late girlfriend Kerstin G meant he had been de facto acting as her mountain guide “as a favour” despite no financial arrangement having been involved. Continue reading...

items.title: Climber convicted of manslaughter after leaving girlfriend on Austria’s highest peak to seek help
items.standfirst: Thomas P given five-month suspended prison sentence and €9,400 fine over death of Kerstin G by gross negligenceEurope live – latest updatesAn amateur mountaineer has been found guilty of gross negligence manslaughter over the death of his girlfriend, whom he left behind on Austria’s highest peak after they got into difficulty on their climb.Thomas P, 37, was handed a five-month suspended sentence and fined €9,400 (£8,200) for causing the death of Kerstin G in January 2025 by gross negligence, an offence that carries a maximum prison term of three years. Continue reading...
items.content: Thomas P given five-month suspended prison sentence and €9,400 fine over death of Kerstin G by gross negligenceEurope live – latest updatesAn amateur mountaineer has been found guilty of gross negligence manslaughter over the death of his girlfriend, whom he left behind on Austria’s highest peak after they got into difficulty on their climb.Thomas P, 37, was handed a five-month suspended sentence and fined €9,400 (£8,200) for causing the death of Kerstin G in January 2025 by gross negligence, an offence that carries a maximum prison term of three years. Continue reading...

items.title: Austrian climber found guilty after girlfriend froze to death on mountain
items.standfirst: The woman died of hypothermia during a climbing trip on the Grossglockner mountain in January 2025.
items.content: The woman died of hypothermia during a climbing trip on the Grossglockner mountain in January 2025.

items.title: Climber found guilty after girlfriend froze to death on mountain
items.standfirst: An amateur climber has been found guilty of gross negligent manslaughter after his girlfriend froze to death on Austria's highest mountain.
items.content: An amateur climber has been found guilty of gross negligent manslaughter after his girlfriend froze to death on Austria's highest mountain.

ai_summary: Amateur climber convicted of manslaughter in Austria
Climber left girlfriend to die on mountain to seek help
Girlfriend died of hypothermia on Grossglockner mountain

Fined €9,400 for causing girlfriend's death

items.standfirst: Police say UK entrepreneur Quentin Griffiths fell from 17th floor of an 18-floor condominium on 9 FebruaryQuentin Griffiths, the co-founder of the online fashion retailer Asos, has died after falling from an apartment building in the Thai seaside resort city of Pattaya.Police told Reuters that the 58-year-old had fallen from the 17th floor of an 18-storey condominium on 9 February. items.content: The author, journalist and philanthropist died at home in Florida, according to Rupert Murdoch's news outlets.

items.title: Tactical, influential and mad about Rupert: Anna Murdoch-Mann remembered after her death aged 81
items.standfirst: Philanthropist and mother of Elisabeth, James and Lachlan Murdoch died at home in Palm Beach, FloridaThe author and philanthropist Anna Murdoch-Mann, the ex-wife of the Australian media tycoon Rupert Murdoch, died at her home in Palm Beach, Florida, on Tuesday. She was 81.Murdoch-Mann’s death was reported Friday by the New York Post, one of her ex-husband’s media properties. Continue reading...

clusters.title: U.S. men's hockey team crushes Slovakia, will face Canada in gold medal game

items.title: U.S. men's hockey team crushes Slovakia, will face Canada in gold medal game
items.standfirst: The U.S. men's hockey team will face Canada on Sunday for the gold medal. The U.S. men have not won gold in the Olympics since the "Miracle on Ice" team in 1980.
items.content: The U.S. men's hockey team will face Canada on Sunday for the gold medal. The U.S. men have not won gold in the Olympics since the "Miracle on Ice" team in 1980.

items.title: After dominant 6-2 win, the U.S. will face Canada for Olympic men's hockey gold
items.standfirst: In the semifinal, Slovakia had few answers for the American onslaught. Now, the U.S. men will meet Canada for a chance to win the team's first Olympic hockey gold since the "Miracle on Ice" back in 1980.
items.content: In the semifinal, Slovakia had few answers for the American onslaught. Now, the U.S. men will meet Canada for a chance to win the team's first Olympic hockey gold since the "Miracle on Ice" back in 1980.(Image credit: JULIEN DE ROSA)
